questions.question_text: Where in Cisco UCM is restrictions on audio bandwidth configured?

discussion.content:
Actually, A and C 
I think correct but A Right, more

Selected Answer: A
In CUCM go to System > Location > Audio Bandwidth

comments.content: Yes. You are right. Make sense. Answer is A

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Bandwidth is asked, Not the Bit rate. Bandwidth is calculated from Bit rates and can restrict the bandwidth also, but again they ask for bandwidth.

Selected Answer: C
Disregard. C is the correct answer

You use regions to limit the bandwidth that is used for audio and video calls within a region and between existing regions by specifying the transport-independent maximum bit rates for audio and for video calls. You can specify the maximum bit rates for audio and video calls within a region and between existing regions. 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/admin/10_0_1/ccmcfg/CUCM_BK_C95ABA82_00_admin-guide-100/CUCM_BK_C95ABA82_00_admin-guide-100_chapter_01000.html

Selected Answer: A
Should be A.

In Cisco Unified Communications Manager Administration, use the System > Location Info menu path to configure locations. Use locations to implement call admission control in a centralized call-processing system. Call admission control enables you to regulate audio quality and video availability by limiting the amount of bandwidth that is available for audio and video calls over links between the locations.

https://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:JQKcEsOKDxsJ:https://community.cisco.com/t5/collaboration-voice-and-video/how-to-specify-the-voip-bandwidth-limit/ta-p/3155102&cd=2&hl=en&ct=clnk&gl=us&client=firefox-b-1-d

Selected Answer: D
"... the voice-class codec <tag> offer all command is used under the specific dial peer. This command ensures that the entire suite of codecs configured under a dial peer is advertised, regardless of the list of advertised codecs in the incoming offer."
Reference: "Understanding SBC's Comprehensive Guide to Designing, Deploying, Troubleshooting, and Maintaining CUBE Solutions" Chapter 5: Media Processing.
Answer is D.

Selected Answer: D
Cisco UBE is configured to filter common codecs for the subsets, by default. The filtered codecs are sent in the outgoing offer. You can configure the Cisco UBE to offer all the codecs configured on an outbound leg instead of offering only the filtered codecs

Selected Answer: D
The offer-all keyword allows the device to offer all codecs configured in a codec voice class.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/voice/cube/configuration/cube-book/voi-negt-aud-code.html

Selected Answer: D
Answer should be D.

The ‘offer-all’ keyword allows the device to offer all codecs configured in a codec voice class.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/voice/cube/configuration/cube-book/voi-negt-aud-code.html#GUID-33D87E85-866D-4F25-A939-54F95B0E3991

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to exhibit. An engineer configured a codec preference list on a Cisco Unified Border Element. Which command is required on the dial peer to ensure that all codecs are offered during an early offer call?

questions.answer_description:
The validity of ITLRecovery has been extended from 5 years to 20 years to ensure that the ITLRecovery certificate remains same for a longer period
Reference:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/security/12_0_1/secugd/cucm_b_cucm-security-guide-1201/cucm_b_cucm-security- guide-1201_chapter_011.html
questions.question_text: What is the validity period of the ITL Recovery certificate in Cisco UCM?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
As per the documentation it's 20 years.
Ref : https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/security/12_0_1/secugd/cucm_b_cucm-security-guide-1201/cucm_b_cucm-security-guide-1201_chapter_011.html#CUCM_TK_V1AF72FD_00

Selected Answer: B
The validity of ITLRecovery has been extended from 5 years to 20 years to ensure that the ITLRecovery certificate remains same for a longer period.

questions.question_text: What is the importance of locations when using location-based CAC within Cisco UCM?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the best answer.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/unified-communications-manager-callmanager/213794-configure-location-bandwidth-manager-and.html

choices.A: They define the geographic regions to which resources are assigned.
choices.D: They define the amount of available bandwidth for the link.
choices.C: They define the minimum bandwidth of the codec that is used for a call.
choices.B: They define the maximum bandwidth of the codec that is used for a call.

questions.question_text: What is the function of the Cisco Unity Connection Call Handler?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Confirming A is correct.

https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/voice_ip_comm/unity/3x/administration/guide/313/SAG_0200.html

choices.B: searches a list of extensions until the call is answered
choices.A: routes calls to a user based on caller input
choices.D: allows customized scripts for IVR capabilities
